business.headline: Sensex ends 387 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Adani Enterprises gains 5%Sensex ends 387 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Adani Enterprises gains 5%

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Adani Power in focus as Sebi clean chit sparks fresh rally in Adani Group stocksAdani Power's move stood out, as analysts see strong momentum beyond the short-term sentiment boost. Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating and a target price of Rs 818 per share.

Adani stocks jump up to 10 % after Sebi clean chit in Hindenburg caseThe gains were broad-based across the group's listed entities. Adani Total Gas led the rally, soaring 10% on the BSE. Adani Power climbed 7%, while flagship Adani Enterprises advanced nearly 5%.
Sensex down over 150 points, Nifty below 25,400; Adani Group stocks jumpThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 260.39 points to 82,753.5, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.95 points to 25,366.65 as of 9:29 am.

PF transfers to become easier: Here's what's changing for employeesThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has now introduced two reforms aimed at tackling these bottlenecks. First, it has launched a Passbook Lite feature within the Member Sewa portal.

EPFO launches Passbook Lite: Check features, how it helps membersUntil now, employees had to log in to a separate Passbook Portal to see details of contributions and withdrawals. With the launch of Passbook Lite, members can now access this information directly on the EPFO Member Portal, using just one login.

Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.

entertainment.headline: 13th trailer: Paresh Pahuja highlights power of teachers beyond classroomsSony LIV's new drama series '13th: Some Lessons Aren't Taught in Classrooms' beautifully explores the deep bond between a mentor and his student. Inspired by the life of renowned educator Mohit Tyagi, the series stars Paresh Pahuja in the lead.

Firoz Nadiadwala sends legal notice to Netflix over use of Baburao characterProducer Feroze Nadiadwala has sent a legal notice to Netflix over the unauthorised use of the Baburao character. The move highlights the importance of protecting intellectual property rights in the creative sector.
Singer Zubeen Garg dies in scuba diving accident in SingaporeRenowned Assamese singer Zubeen Garg died after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. He was 52 years old.

Aneet Padda replacing Kiara Advani in Shakti Shalini? Maddock Films respondsThe recent reports of actor Aneet Padda featuring in the under-production horror-comedy universe film 'Shakti Shalini' were addressed by the production house. The official statement clarified whether actor Kiara Advani has been replaced by Aneet.

Jimmy Kimmel enraged after show's cancellation linked to Charlie Kirk remarkJimmy Kimmel was suspended from ABC after making remarks concerning Charlie Kirk's death. Prominent figures and broadcasters were divided over the decision and free speech issues.

KBC 17: Carpenter Chhinder Pal fails to answer Rs 1 crore question. Can you?Carpenter Chhinder Pal secures Rs 50 lakh on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. Host Amitabh Bachchan expresses astonishment at Pal's performance

Can't change what happened: Kalki director's cryptic note amid Deepika's exitDirector Nag Ashwin shared a cryptic message on social media, which comes amid Deepika Padukone's abrupt exit from the sequel to 'Kalki 2898 AD'. The post has gone viral on social media.

Ameesha Patel says boys have world vision, prefers their company over girlsAmeesha Patel expressed her preference for male company over female friends, appreciating the broader perspectives and world vision men bring to conversations. Her remarks sparked mixed reactions on social media.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 26: Abhishek-Amaal clash over chicken sparks chaos'Bigg Boss 19' episode 26 opened with fiery clashes, from Shehbaz's 'woman card' remark to Abhishek and Amaal's heated food fight, setting the tone for a dramatic episode. The episode also revealed an emotional side, as Amaal broke down and apologised to Baseer, earning both comfort and support.

Daredevil Born Again confirmed for Season 3, filming to begin in 2026Marvel fans in India can rejoice as 'Daredevil: Born Again' is confirmed for a third season on Disney+. The filming starts in early 2026.

Shraddha Kapoor confirms relationship with Rahul Mody, shares adorable videoShraddha Kapoor confirmed her relationship with writer Rahul Mody through a playful Instagram video, finally ending months of speculation.

Toxic: Yash wraps 45-day Mumbai schedule, heads to Bengaluru for final legYash's much-anticipated film 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-ups' has completed its challenging Mumbai schedule, marking a significant phase in its six-month shoot. The production now moves to Bengaluru for the final leg.

What is the cause of Tamil actor Robo Shankar's death at 46?Tamil comedy actor Robo Shankar died at the age of 46 on Thursday. He is survived by his wife, daughter, son-in-law and grandson. The actor collapsed on a set on September 16 and was rushed to a private hospital in Chennai.

Shabana Azmi-Javed Akhtar's dance to Pretty Little Baby wins internet, now viralShabana Azmi celebrated her 75th birthday with a heartwarming dance with her husband Javed Akhtar, leaving guests and fans delighted. The star-studded evening saw Bollywood celebrities cheering as the legendary couple stole the show.
Pawan Singh makes sudden exit from Rise & Fall: ReportBhojpuri actor and singer Pawan Singh has left the show 'Rise & Fall', marking the programme's second major exit.

Nishaanchi review: A punchy potboiler weighed down by Anurag Kashyap's indulgenceRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Anurag Kashyap's 'Nishaanchi' offers a colourful mix of drama, humour and strong performances. The film's overindulgence and familiar tropes may divide audiences, but a sequel promises more twists.

I'm a fan of the tan: Ananya Panday reacts to her viral look from Ba***ds screeningAnanya Panday's return from the Maldives grabbed attention not just for her holiday pictures but for her striking tan that sparked lively conversations on social media. Embracing the banter with humour, she confidently shone at the Netflix premiere of 'The Bads of Bollywood' in Mumbai, winning hearts with her charm.

Rapper Arivu reacts to backlash over Vedan collab amid sexual abuse allegationsRapper Arivu responded to criticism after collaborating with Vedan, who is facing multiple sexual abuse accusations. Social media users criticise Arivu and director Mari Selvaraj for platforming Vedan.

Jolly LLB 3 review: Akshay-Arshad bring charm but Saurabh Shukla owns the courtroomRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Jolly LLB 3 review: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi deliver entertaining performances in Subhash Kapoor's courtroom drama, but it's Saurabh Shukla as Judge Tripathi who steals the show. A witty mix of satire, comedy, and social commentary, the film balances laughs with a hard-hitting story.

general news.headline: ABVP wins big in Dusu polls, Aryan Maan clinches President's post from NSUIAryan secured 28,841 votes, while NSUI's Joslyn managed 12,645. Of the four posts, ABVP won three — President, Secretary, and Joint Secretary — but lost the Vice President's seat.
Singer Zubeen Garg dies in scuba diving accident in SingaporeRenowned Assamese singer Zubeen Garg died after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. He was 52 years old.

BJP gets Gen Z bragging rightsEven as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi sought to woo Gen Z with his "vote chori" pitch, the DUSU results handed the ABVP, the student wing of the RSS, the BJP's ideological parent, a clear edge in the battle for young minds in the Delhi University Students Union election.

Faced racial hatred while working for Google: Indian techie shot by US cops posted on LinkedInTelangana techie Mohammed Nizamuddin was shot dead by the police in the US after an alleged scuffle with his roommate. In his last LinkedIn post, he claimed racial abuse, wrongful termination by Google, and threats to his safety. His family has brought up these concerns and also appealed the Indian government for help in repatriating his body.

When India gave China a bloody nose in forgotten battles of 1967After its humiliating defeat to China in the 1962 war, India turned the tables just a few years later. In two little-known battles in 1967 at Nathu La and Cho La, fought weeks apart, Indian forces pushed back the Chinese and restored a measure of pride. Eighty-eight Indian bravehearts laid down their lives, but the toll on the Chinese side was over 300. This victory cemented India's hold over Sikkim, and shattered China's aura of invincibility.

Sam Pitroda returns. Says I feel at home in Pakistan. BJP takes 26/11 jabSam Pitroda, no stranger to controversies, urged India to focus on its neighbourhood first, asserting that he always felt at home during his visits to Pakistan, a state sponsor of terrorism in India.

Rahul Gandhi's Gen Z shoutout amid vote chori row gets BJP's stinging comebackThe timing of the post, with Rahul Gandhi invoking the Gen Z, is crucial. Just days ago, a violent protest by Nepal's Gen Z unseated the KP Sharma Oli government.

He is f**king me: Trump's frustration with Israel's Netanyahu exposedTrump's remark signals that his patience with Netanyahu is wearing thin amid increasing Israeli operations across Iran, Lebanon, Syria, Yemen and now Qatar.

Skating by day, coding by night: Engineering student Anandkumar's road to gloryFrom the streets of Chennai to the world stage, Anandkumar Velkumar rewrote Indian skating history. The 22-year-old engineering student turned years of practice into gold to become the country's first inline speed skating world champion.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

Slaps, blows, grappling: Crowd at Mumbai iPhone 17 launch erupts into free-for-allThe iPhone 17 launch in India turned into chaos on Friday after large crowds gathered outside various Apple Stores. Clearly, craze for latest iPhones has hit an all-time high.

In bid to woo Xi Jinping, is Trump throwing Taiwan under the bus?US President Trump has halted shipment of $400-million arms shipment to Taiwan, according to a report in The Washington Post. The report comes just ahead of Trump's call with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping. Xi has asserted claims over Taiwan, and the island nation fears a military invasion by China. Is a transactional Trump sacrificing Taiwan for a trade deal with China?

Day 7 Live Updates: Noah Lyles eyes historic gold, Annu Rani in actionWorld Athletics Championships Day 7 Live: All eyes will be on Noah Lyles as he aims to secure his fourth consecutive World Championship gold in the men's 200m final on Friday, September 19. India's Annu Rani and Gulveer Singh will also be in action in women's javelin and men's 5000m heats.

Wake up at 4 am, delete voters, go to sleep: Rahul Gandhi on art of 'vote chori'Rahul Gandhi kept up his attack on the Election Commission over alleged illegal deletion of voters in another post on Friday. In a tongue-in-cheek post, he revealed how the alleged vote theft was carried out.

US closes caste bias, worker exploitation case against BAPS temple in New JerseyThe US Department of Justice and Attorney's Office for the District of New Jersey have closed the four-year investigation into alleged caste discrimination and worker exploitation at the BAPS temple in New Jersey. The probe began in 2021 after a lawsuit by six Indian workers, which BAPS maintains was based on false claims of forced labour.

Maruti Suzuki Victoris review: Is this the mid-size SUV game-changer?Maruti Suzuki's Victoris takes direct aim at the Korean duo with bold design, multiple powertrains including hybrid, CNG and AWD, and a feature-rich, safety-first package. Priced aggressively under Rs 20 lakh, it blends mass-market accessibility with premium polish, signalling Maruti's most decisive push yet into the hotly contested C-segment SUV space.

France's Macron to offer scientific proof in US court to prove his wife is a womanFrench President Emmanuel Macron and wife Brigitte plan to present evidence in a US court to counter transgender claims. Owens has repeatedly alleged that Brigitte Macron was born male and transitioned before marrying Emmanuel Macron.

Jolly LLB 3 review: Akshay-Arshad bring charm but Saurabh Shukla owns the courtroomRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Jolly LLB 3 review: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi deliver entertaining performances in Subhash Kapoor's courtroom drama, but it's Saurabh Shukla as Judge Tripathi who steals the show. A witty mix of satire, comedy, and social commentary, the film balances laughs with a hard-hitting story.

US blocks Pak, China bid to sanction Balochistan Liberation Army at UNIn blocking the joint bid to sanction the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) and its suicide wing, the Majeed Brigade, under the UN 1267 regime, the US and allies noted that there was insufficient evidence linking the groups to Al Qaeda or ISIL.

Misdiagnosis, antibiotics, syrup use are making India's cough crisis worseMost cough cases diagnosed in India are either uncategorised or incorrect. Moreover, there's the issue of rampant antibiotic prescriptions, and controversial cough syrup use. The solution lies in patient education and robust guidelines for cough management.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Manmohan Singh thanked Yasin Malik for meeting Hafiz Saeed: BJP's big chargeUpon his return from Pakistan, he was instructed to debrief then-Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who thanked Malik for his role in the back-channel peace talks, according to Yasin Malik's affidavit, which was tweeted by BJP's IT head Amit Malaviya.

Gaganyaan mission being updated with inputs from Shux's Ax-4 missionTechnical debriefings and design adaptations are underway at ISRO's Human Space Flight Centre. The Gaganyaan G-1 mission remains on schedule for a December launch.

sports.headline: Buoyed by record win, India eye historic series triumph before Women's World CupINDW vs AUSW: India women's cricket team is on the verge of a historic bilateral series win against Australia when the two teams meet on September 20 in New Delhi. The upcoming match could redefine the rivalry and boost India's confidence ahead of the Women's World Cup.

Day 7 Live Updates: Noah Lyles eyes historic gold, Annu Rani in actionWorld Athletics Championships Day 7 Live: All eyes will be on Noah Lyles as he aims to secure his fourth consecutive World Championship gold in the men's 200m final on Friday, September 19. India's Annu Rani and Gulveer Singh will also be in action in women's javelin and men's 5000m heats.

Erling Haaland can break the UCL record of Cristiano Ronaldo: Pep GuardiolaPep Guardiola believes Erling Haaland has what it takes to one day eclipse Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi in Europe. The Manchester City striker just became the fastest to reach 50 Champions League goals, achieving it in 49 games.

Asia Cup 2025, Super 4s: Know India's full schedule in 2nd phase of tournamentIndia are all set to enter as favourites as the Super 4s of the Asia Cup 2025 is all set to begin from September 19. India will take on Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka during the second phase of the tournament.

Australia face more misery after embarrassing loss in 2nd ODI vs IndiaAustralia were fined 10 per cent of their match fee for a slow over-rate following their 102-run defeat to India in the second ODI, marking their first-ever loss by 100 plus runs in ODI history. They will aim to bounce back in the third ODI in New Delhi ahead of the Women's World Cup.

Suryakumar Yadav proper Rohit Sharma replacement as India T20I captain: KaifMohammed Kaif praised Suryakumar Yadav, calling him the ideal replacement for Rohit Sharma as India's T20I captain after a dominant start to the Asia Cup campaign. Suryakumar took over as captain after Rohit's retirement in 2024.

Bring it Home: ICC releases anthem for Women's World Cup (Watch)The ICC has released the official anthem 'Bring it Home' for the Women's World Cup 2025, sung by Shreya Ghoshal. The anthem sets the tone for the tournament as India aims to win its first World Cup title in 12 years.

Australia captain Pat Cummins on Ashes participation: A bit of wait and seePat Cummins said that he is hoping to play all five Tests during the Ashes series, but admitted that it will be a bit of a waiting game for him when it comes to his fitness. Cummins hasn't bowled since the West Indies tour earlier in the year.

Josh Inglis ruled out of T20I series with calf strain in big blow for AustraliaJosh Inglis has been ruled out of the upcoming T20I series against New Zealand due to a right calf strain. His absence adds to Australia's injury concerns ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup preparations.

West Indies hoping to do a New Zealand on India with strong pace attack: Daren SammyWest Indies coach Daren Sammy believes his strong pace attack led by Shamar Joseph, Alzarri Joseph, and Jayden Searles can take 20 wickets and upset India in the upcoming two-Test series starting October 2 in Ahmedabad.

Supreme Court approves AIFF draft constitution, Kalyan Chaubey to complete tenureThe Supreme Court has approved AIFF's new draft constitution, setting the stage for governance reforms and clearer operations in Indian football. The court also ruled no fresh elections are needed, allowing Kalyan Chaubey to complete his tenure.

Bring it Home: ICC releases anthem for Women's World Cup (Watch)The ICC has released the official anthem 'Bring it Home' for the Women's World Cup 2025, sung by Shreya Ghoshal. The anthem sets the tone for the tournament as India aims to win its first World Cup title in 12 years.

Australia captain Pat Cummins on Ashes participation: A bit of wait and seePat Cummins said that he is hoping to play all five Tests during the Ashes series, but admitted that it will be a bit of a waiting game for him when it comes to his fitness. Cummins hasn't bowled since the West Indies tour earlier in the year.

Josh Inglis ruled out of T20I series with calf strain in big blow for AustraliaJosh Inglis has been ruled out of the upcoming T20I series against New Zealand due to a right calf strain. His absence adds to Australia's injury concerns ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup preparations.

West Indies hoping to do a New Zealand on India with strong pace attack: Daren SammyWest Indies coach Daren Sammy believes his strong pace attack led by Shamar Joseph, Alzarri Joseph, and Jayden Searles can take 20 wickets and upset India in the upcoming two-Test series starting October 2 in Ahmedabad.

Supreme Court approves AIFF draft constitution, Kalyan Chaubey to complete tenureThe Supreme Court has approved AIFF's new draft constitution, setting the stage for governance reforms and clearer operations in Indian football. The court also ruled no fresh elections are needed, allowing Kalyan Chaubey to complete his tenure.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
